inlineContent.text: Welcome to the Advanced Usage tutorial, where you’ll learn how to master this powerful tool to take your network debugging skills to the next level! In this comprehensive guide, you’ll discover how to save, import, and export requests and responses, map local responses, simulate various network conditions, manage block/allow lists, and explore extra features exclusive to certain network debugging tools. Get ready to become a network debugging expert and make your app development process even more efficient.
In this section you learn how to save any request or responses, Import/Export settings
Try to Export all the breakpoint rules you have.
See how the import feature work!
Try to see if you could import any Charles setting into the Proxyman.
Save response bodies from ‘api/people’ and ‘api/films’ as Json, we need them in the next section.
Get rid of any backend env for your project and map all the responses to your local
JSONs
Use
Map Local
feature and try to map responses from ‘api/people’ and ‘api/films’ to the local json files.
Have you ever wanted to test your app in different network connection situations?
Let’s try it together.
Try to apply a network condition to one of the APIs and see how it works.
You could try 100% loss network to see if you were handled this error type in your project or you are lucky that you app still is not crashing.
Let’s have fun, if you want to block all the traffics from your phone, now it’s the time.
Or you can only allow some URLs and ignore the rest ;-).
Try to block ‘swapi.dev’ and make sure you are either pointing at a local server or your local files.
If you made an Allow list, you would not be able to do call anything else than those list.
If you have time you can check out the following tools to get your hands dirty.
Proxyman Only featurs:
Try to work with
Scripting
feature and see how far you could go with.
Charles Only featurs:
Try to work with
Rewrite
feature and see how far you could go with.
and
Next step is trying to make Charles Feature working on Proxyman:
Try to work with
Mirro
feature using
Charles
and see how far you could go with and try to do similar thing in
Proxyman
using
Scripting
and

abstract.text: Welcome to the Man In The Middle Attack tutorial! In this tutorial, you’ll learn about the importance of using SSL Pinning to avoid man-in-the-middle (MITM) attacks and protect your app’s communication.

Welcome to the Basic Proxying tutorial! In this comprehensive guide, you’ll learn how to inspect your app in greater detail and effectively collaborate with back-end developers by sending cURL requests and responses. You’ll also discover how to map network traffic, use breakpoints to manipulate data on-the-fly, and leverage the Repeat tool to resend requests without client involvement. Prepare to dive deep into the world of network debugging and enhance your skills in proxying and app inspection.

Welcome to the Ultimate Network Debugging Tutorial! In this tutorial, you’ll learn a variety of techniques to debug network-related issues in your app. To get started, you’ll first download a sample project from GitHub that will serve as a practical example for applying the concepts covered in this tutorial.

Welcome to the App Inspection tutorial! In this brief yet informative guide, you’ll learn how to track all network traffic on your device and inspect the details of requests and responses going through www.swapi.dev. Get ready to enhance your network debugging capabilities by mastering the art of app inspection with powerful tools like Proxyman and Charles.

Welcome to the Advanced Usage tutorial, where you’ll learn how to master this powerful tool to take your network debugging skills to the next level! In this comprehensive guide, you’ll discover how to save, import, and export requests and responses, map local responses, simulate various network conditions, manage block/allow lists, and explore extra features exclusive to certain network debugging tools. Get ready to become a network debugging expert and make your app development process even more efficient.

Welcome to the Basic Proxying tutorial! In this comprehensive guide, you’ll learn how to inspect your app in greater detail and effectively collaborate with back-end developers by sending cURL requests and responses. You’ll also discover how to map network traffic, use breakpoints to manipulate data on-the-fly, and leverage the Repeat tool to resend requests without client involvement.
